It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and damp soil. Its thalloid body is leafy and lacks true roots, stems, or leaves in the traditional sense. Polytaenium discoideum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
